fields.headline: Goodwill Games archive
fields.bodyText: Boldon fails test for banned stimulant September 9: Ato Boldon, a long-time anti-doping campaigner, is the latest big-name athlete to fail a drugs test. Bucher scoops the loot September 10: Andre Bucher's victory in the 800 metres took the Swiss runner to the top of the overall grand prix rankings for the first time this season. Superman takes his leave with more gold September 8: Michael Johnson bade farewell to a sport he has dominated for a decade when he ran the final leg of the 4x400 metres relay. A stroll towards travesty September 7: Some of the world's finest middle-distance runners turned their events into a travesty yesterday with a series of shockingly poor times and a blatent lack of effort. Victory 'shocks' Chambers September 6: With Maurice Greene absent, Dwain Chambers took his opportunity to win the 100 metres and a fistful of dollars. Edwards lands leap of fortune September 5: Jonathan Edwards lined his retirement fund with £41,200 when he won the triple jump in Brisbane, while Marion Jones won the 100m. Lucre the lure at Goodwill Games September 4: Big fat wads of US dollars await the triumphant in the Goodwill Games at the ANZ stadium in Brisbane.
